term.element: This category groups all default objects, which are a collection of attributes and properties.

An ontology term represents a concept unrelated to a context. As a vocabulary word changes its meaning depending on its position in a sentence, the same term may be used in different places in the ontology, meaning in different contexts, to represent different things. Terms are organised as a dictionary, without relationships between each other.
An ontology node is essentially an ontology term in context. Nodes are the vertices of the ontology graph and are connected by relationships.

An ontology edge relates ontology nodes via a predicate. Edges are represented by a triplet: subject, predicate and object, in which the subject and the object are ontology nodes and the predicate is an ontology term.
An ontology tag represents the path between an ontology feature vertex and an ontology scale vertex. Tags record the terms referenced by the vertices and the predicates that relate them.
Users collect all information specific to the system users.
